revised_title: Anatomy and Function of Mammary Glands in Ornithorhynchus paradoxus
tldr: The author examines the mammary glands of the Ornithorhynchus paradoxus, a unique animal with features that set it apart from other mammals. They analyze the structure and function of these glands, concluding that they are indeed mammary glands despite some differences in their appearance and function compared to typical mammalian mammary glands. The author also notes that the young of this animal can be sustained by cow's milk, further supporting the classification of these glands as mammary glands.
